if you're using crypto cards in Argentina, you're probably losing money on FX spread

(even with up to 5% cashback)

ran the numbers on @joinpeanut via Mercado Pago vs my Coca Premium card

the math:

market rate baseline: ARS 1,447.18 per USD (Feb 4, 2026)

@joinpeanut: ARS 1,479.42 per USD
‚Üí paying 2.23% ABOVE market (rare, probably subsidized (?) )

Coca Premium (0% FX): ARS 1,369.86 per USD
‚Üí paying 5.34% BELOW market
‚Üí 5% cashback almost compensates, but not quite

spread gap: 8%
net after cashback: Peanut still 2.57% cheaper

$500/month spend breakdown:

Peanut: get ARS 739,710
COCA: get ARS 684,930 (even after $25 cashback)
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
difference: ~$13/month = $156/year lost

the move:

use Peanut for Argentina (exceptional FX rate)

lesson learned: always check FX spread first, cashback second

when spread difference is 8%, no cashback tier can save you
